speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Mistress Ford, your sorrow hath eaten up

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: my sufferance. I see you are obsequious in your

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: love, and I profess requital to a hair’s breadth, not

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: only, Mistress Ford, in the simple office of love,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: but in all the accoutrement, compliment, and ceremony

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: of it. But are you sure of your husband now?

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              FORD
text: He’s a-birding, sweet Sir John.

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: What ho, gossip Ford! What

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: ho!

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              FORD
text: Step into th’ chamber, Sir John.

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: How now, sweetheart, who’s at home

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: besides yourself?

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              FORD
text: Why, none but mine own people.

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: Indeed?

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              FORD
text:
No, certainly.
                 
                Aside
                 
                to
                 
                her
                .
               Speak

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              FORD
text: louder.

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: Truly, I am so glad you have nobody

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: here.

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              FORD
text: Why?

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: Why, woman, your husband is in his

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: old lunes again. He so takes on yonder with my

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: husband, so rails against all married mankind, so

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: curses all Eve’s daughters of what complexion soever,

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: and so buffets himself on the forehead, crying

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: “Peer out, peer out!” that any madness I ever yet

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: beheld seemed but tameness, civility, and patience

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: to this his distemper he is in now. I am glad the fat

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: knight is not here.

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              FORD
text: Why, does he talk of him?

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: Of none but him, and swears he was

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: carried out, the last time he searched for him, in a

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: basket; protests to my husband he is now here;

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: and hath drawn him and the rest of their company

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: from their sport to make another experiment of

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: his suspicion. But I am glad the knight is not here.

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: Now he shall see his own foolery.

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              FORD
text: How near is he, Mistress Page?

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: Hard by, at street end. He will be here

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: anon.

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              FORD
text: I am undone! The knight is here.

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: Why then, you are utterly shamed, and

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: he’s but a dead man. What a woman are you! Away

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: with him, away with him! Better shame than

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: murder.

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              FORD
text: Which way should he go? How should

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              FORD
text: I bestow him? Shall I put him into the basket

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              FORD
text: again?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: No, I’ll come no more i’ th’ basket. May I not

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: go out ere he come?

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: Alas, three of Master Ford’s brothers

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: watch the door with pistols, that none shall issue

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: out. Otherwise you might slip away ere he came.

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: But what make you here?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: What shall I do? I’ll creep up into the

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: chimney.

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              FORD
text: There they always use to discharge

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              FORD
text: their birding pieces.

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: Creep into the kiln-hole.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Where is it?

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              FORD
text: He will seek there, on my word. Neither

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              FORD
text: press, coffer, chest, trunk, well, vault, but he

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              FORD
text: hath an abstract for the remembrance of such

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              FORD
text: places, and goes to them by his note. There is no

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              FORD
text: hiding you in the house.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: I’ll go out, then.

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: If you go out in your own semblance,

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: you die, Sir John—unless you go out disguised.

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              FORD
text: How might we disguise him?

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: Alas the day, I know not. There is no

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: woman’s gown big enough for him; otherwise he

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: might put on a hat, a muffler, and a kerchief, and

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: so escape.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Good hearts, devise something. Any extremity

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: rather than a mischief.

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              FORD
text: My maid’s aunt, the fat woman of

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              FORD
text: Brentford, has a gown above.

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: On my word, it will serve him. She’s as

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: big as he is. And there’s her thrummed hat and her

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: muffler too.—Run up, Sir John.

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              FORD
text: Go, go, sweet Sir John. Mistress Page

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              FORD
text: and I will look some linen for your head.

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: Quick, quick! We’ll come dress you

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: straight. Put on the gown the while.

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              FORD
text: I would my husband would meet him

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              FORD
text: in this shape. He cannot abide the old woman of

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              FORD
text: Brentford. He swears she’s a witch, forbade her my

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              FORD
text: house, and hath threatened to beat her.

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: Heaven guide him to thy husband’s

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: cudgel, and the devil guide his cudgel afterwards!

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              FORD
text: But is my husband coming?

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: Ay, in good sadness is he, and talks of

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: the basket too, howsoever he hath had

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: intelligence.

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              FORD
text: We’ll try that; for I’ll appoint my men

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              FORD
text: to carry the basket again, to meet him at the door

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              FORD
text: with it as they did last time.

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: Nay, but he’ll be here presently. Let’s go

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: dress him like the witch of Brentford.

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              FORD
text: I’ll first direct my men what they shall

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              FORD
text: do with the basket. Go up. I’ll bring linen for him

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              FORD
text: straight.

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: Hang him, dishonest varlet! We cannot

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: misuse him enough.

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text:
We’ll
               
              leave
               
              a
               
              proof
              ,
               
              by
               
              that
               
              which
               
              we
               
              will
               
              do
              ,

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text:
Wives
               
              may
               
              be
               
              merry
               
              and
               
              yet
               
              honest
               
              too
              .

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text:
We
               
              do
               
              not
               
              act
               
              that
               
              often
               
              jest
               
              and
               
              laugh
              ;

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text:
’Tis
               
              old
               
              but
               
              true
              :
               
              “
              Still
               
              swine
               
              eats
               
              all
               
              the
               
              draff
              .
              ”

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              FORD
text: Go, sirs, take the basket again on your

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              FORD
text: shoulders. Your master is hard at door. If he bid

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              FORD
text: you set it down, obey him. Quickly, dispatch.

speaker: ROBERT
text: Come, come, take it up.

speaker: JOHN
text: Pray heaven it be not full of knight again.

speaker: ROBERT
text: I hope not. I had lief as bear so much lead.

speaker: FORD
text: Ay, but if it prove true, Master Page, have you

speaker: FORD
text: any way then to unfool me again?—Set down the

speaker: FORD
text:
basket, villain.
                 
                They
                 
                put
                 
                the
                 
                basket
                 
                down
                .
               Somebody

speaker: FORD
text: call my wife. Youth in a basket! O, you panderly

speaker: FORD
text: rascals! There’s a knot, a gang, a pack, a

speaker: FORD
text: conspiracy against me. Now shall the devil be

speaker: FORD
text: shamed.—What, wife, I say! Come, come forth!

speaker: FORD
text: Behold what honest clothes you send forth to

speaker: FORD
text: bleaching!

speaker: PAGE
text: Why, this passes, Master Ford! You are not to go

speaker: PAGE
text: loose any longer; you must be pinioned.

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: Why, this is lunatics. This is mad as a mad

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: dog.

speaker: SHALLOW
text: Indeed, Master Ford, this is not well, indeed.

speaker: FORD
text: So say I too, sir.

speaker: FORD
text: Come hither, Mistress Ford.—Mistress Ford, the

speaker: FORD
text: honest woman, the modest wife, the virtuous creature,

speaker: FORD
text: that hath the jealous fool to her husband!—I

speaker: FORD
text: suspect without cause, mistress, do I?

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              FORD
text: Heaven be my witness you do, if you

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              FORD
text: suspect me in any dishonesty.

speaker: FORD
text: Well said, brazen-face. Hold it out.—Come

speaker: FORD
text: forth, sirrah.

speaker: PAGE
text: This passes.

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              FORD
text: Are you not ashamed? Let the clothes

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              FORD
text: alone.

speaker: FORD
text: I shall find you anon.

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: ’Tis unreasonable. Will you take up your

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: wife’s clothes? Come, away.

speaker: FORD
text: Empty the basket, I say.

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              FORD
text: Why, man, why?

speaker: FORD
text: Master Page, as I am a man, there was one conveyed

speaker: FORD
text: out of my house yesterday in this basket.

speaker: FORD
text: Why may not he be there again? In my house I am

speaker: FORD
text: sure he is. My intelligence is true, my jealousy is

speaker: FORD
text: reasonable.—Pluck me out all the linen.

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              FORD
text: If you find a man there, he shall die a

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              FORD
text: flea’s death.

speaker: PAGE
text: Here’s no man.

speaker: SHALLOW
text: By my fidelity, this is not well, Master Ford.

speaker: SHALLOW
text: This wrongs you.

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: Master Ford, you must pray, and not follow

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: the imaginations of your own heart. This is

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: jealousies.

speaker: FORD
text: Well, he’s not here I seek for.

speaker: PAGE
text: No, nor nowhere else but in your brain.

speaker: FORD
text: Help to search my house this one time. If I find

speaker: FORD
text: not what I seek, show no color for my extremity.

speaker: FORD
text: Let me forever be your table-sport. Let them say of

speaker: FORD
text: me “As jealous as Ford, that searched a hollow

speaker: FORD
text: walnut for his wife’s leman.” Satisfy me once

speaker: FORD
text: more. Once more search with me.

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              FORD
text: What ho, Mistress

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              FORD
text: Page! Come you and the old woman down. My

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              FORD
text: husband will come into the chamber.

speaker: FORD
text: “Old woman”? What old woman’s that?

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              FORD
text: Why, it is my maid’s aunt of Brentford.

speaker: FORD
text: A witch, a quean, an old cozening quean! Have

speaker: FORD
text: I not forbid her my house? She comes of errands,

speaker: FORD
text: does she? We are simple men; we do not know

speaker: FORD
text: what’s brought to pass under the profession of

speaker: FORD
text: fortune-telling. She works by charms, by spells, by

speaker: FORD
text: th’ figure, and such daubery as this is, beyond our

speaker: FORD
text: element. We know nothing.— Come down, you

speaker: FORD
text: witch, you hag, you! Come down, I say!

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              FORD
text: Nay, good sweet husband!—Good gentlemen,

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              FORD
text: let him not strike the old woman.

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: Come, Mother Pratt; come, give me

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: your hand.

speaker: FORD
text:
I’ll pratt her. 
                (
                He
                 
                beats
                 
                Falstaff
                .
                )
               Out of my

speaker: FORD
text: door, you witch, you rag, you baggage, you polecat,

speaker: FORD
text: you runnion! Out, out! I’ll conjure you, I’ll

speaker: FORD
text: fortune-tell you!

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: Are you not ashamed? I think you have

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: killed the poor woman.

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              FORD
text: Nay, he will do it.—’Tis a goodly credit

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              FORD
text: for you.

speaker: FORD
text: Hang her, witch!

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: By yea and no, I think the ’oman is a witch

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: indeed. I like not when a ’oman has a great peard.

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: I spy a great peard under her muffler.

speaker: FORD
text: Will you follow, gentlemen? I beseech you, follow.

speaker: FORD
text: See but the issue of my jealousy. If I cry out

speaker: FORD
text: thus upon no trail, never trust me when I open

speaker: FORD
text: again.

speaker: PAGE
text: Let’s obey his humor a little further. Come,

speaker: PAGE
text: gentlemen.

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: Trust me, he beat him most pitifully.

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              FORD
text: Nay, by th’ Mass, that he did not; he

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              FORD
text: beat him most unpitifully, methought.

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: I’ll have the cudgel hallowed and hung

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: o’er the altar. It hath done meritorious service.

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              FORD
text: What think you? May we, with the

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              FORD
text: warrant of womanhood and the witness of a good

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              FORD
text: conscience, pursue him with any further revenge?

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: The spirit of wantonness is, sure,

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: scared out of him. If the devil have him not in fee

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: simple, with fine and recovery, he will never, I

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: think, in the way of waste, attempt us again.

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              FORD
text: Shall we tell our husbands how we

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              FORD
text: have served him?

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: Yes, by all means—if it be but to scrape

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: the figures out of your husband’s brains. If they

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: can find in their hearts the poor unvirtuous fat

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: knight shall be any further afflicted, we two will

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: still be the ministers.

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              FORD
text: I’ll warrant they’ll have him publicly

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              FORD
text: shamed, and methinks there would be no period to

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              FORD
text: the jest should he not be publicly shamed.

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: Come, to the forge with it, then shape

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: it. I would not have things cool.
